item.title: Comment on Thursday assorted links by mkt42
item.description:
"Curious: why are ALL drivers (Uber, taxi, whatever) so right wing? I have literally never had a left wing one. And they seemingly all volunteer their political views without prompting. Is it because by driving around for a living one actually sees what’s going on in the country?"

I've never had an Uber or Lyft driver tell me their political views, left or right.

I suspect that this passenger spouts off about politics, and the drivers respond.

They may indeed skew right-wing, but I wouldn't know. I've never had one who talked politics.

What they often do talk about, because I often do ask them, is the business model and practices of Uber and Lyft. Because that's what I ask them about. Some of them are very clever, doing their own data analysis to work out, not just supply and demand conditions at a given time and place, but how the algorithm works to incentivize the drivers. And then they figure out their own optimal work pattern.

There's also an interesting range of satisfaction vs dissatisfaction with their companies. Granted that's probably true of workers in all jobs.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/10/thursday-assorted-links-474.html?commentID=160826248
